title.native: 劇場版 ベルサイユのばら

description:
Movie project commemorating the 50th anniversary of the Versailles no Bara manga's publication.

Hoping to unite their countries with an alliance, The Empress of Austria arranges her daughter, the delightful yet spoiled Marie Antoinette, to marry the crown prince of France, Louis XVI. Upon arriving in Versailles, the Austrian princess meets Oscar Francois de Jarjayes, Captain of the Royal Guards—a seemingly dashing young man—but to Antoinette's astonishment, he is in fact a woman!

The youngest daughter of a noble family with a prominent lack of a male heir, Oscar was raised as a boy to continue the family's military legacy. Suffocated by the rigid rules associated with her new position and longing for companionship, Antoinette immediately takes a liking to this intriguing young woman, and wastes no time befriending her. However, as the childish new queen foolishly abuses her power, Oscar is conflicted between maintaining her loyalty to the royal family and addressing the growing concern of poverty among the common people.

Recalling the events of the French Revolution, Versailles no Bara depicts the struggles of two women unjustly burdened by family expectations. Yet, despite being forced to deny their identities at the expense of personal happiness, they march on to become key players in the annals of history.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)
hashtag: #ベルサイユのばら #ベルばら #ベルばら映画

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Royal Affairs
tags.description: Features nobility, alliances, arranged marriage, succession disputes, religious orders and other elements of royal politics.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

name.native: マクシミリアン・ド・ロベスピエール
レニエ・ド・ジャルジェ
ロザリー・ラモリエール

node.description:
Ikeda made her debut in 1967 with [Bara Yashiki no Shoujo](https://anilist.co/manga/111369/Bara-Yashiki-no-Shoujo) in Shoujo Friend when she still was a philosophy student. She was the first to pick up a historic theme in her highly acclaimed [Versailles no Bara](https://anilist.co/manga/30660/Versailles-no-Bara) and did other impressive historical works. She is part of the Year 24 Group. 

It's rumored she had an affair with a politician and Ikeda disappeared from the manga-scene around the mid-80's. However she returned at the end of 1998 again with [Orpheus no Mado Gaiden](https://anilist.co/manga/94262/Orpheus-no-Mado-Gaiden).  

In 2008, Ikeda received France's Ordre national de la Légion d'honneur.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡真里子)

Originating from Studio Live. Notable works as a character designer include [Jigoku Shoujo](https://anilist.co/anime/228/), [Ghost Hound](https://anilist.co/anime/2596/) and [Nurarihyon no Mago](https://anilist.co/anime/7592/). Close friends with [Hiroshi Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/101189/), and often designs the characters for the shows which he directs.

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147) 

Composer and musician represented by VV-ALKLINE since 2017. He was previously with Legendoor from 2006 to 2017. 
Sawano began practicing the piano at an early age, and studied composition, arrangement, orchestration, and piano under Nobuchika Tsuboi from the age of 17.

Active as a composer since 2004, he first gained recognition for his work on the Team Medical Dragon TV drama in 2006. He made his debut as an anime composer in 2006 on [Soul Link](https://anilist.co/anime/854/). In 2009, he released his first solo album *musica*, which included some of his more popular songs done for TV shows. In 2014, he launched a new vocal song project under the name "SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]", producing the first album *UnChild* with [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/) as the vocalist under the name SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]:Aimer. Since then his songs under this vocal song project have also been used as the opening and ending themes for various anime.

He has cited [Joe Hisaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/100738/), [Youko Kanno](https://anilist.co/staff/95508/), [Hans Zimmer](https://anilist.co/staff/104669/) and Danny Elfman as major inspirations.

Non-anime role:

• **Xenoblade Chronicles X (music)** 
• **Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition (music)**

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kohta_yamabook) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yamabook_kohta/) | [Website](https://www.kohtayamamoto.net/)

Formerly affiliated with Legendoor, he is now in business partnership with VV-ALKLINE.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/jussaramarques/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Jussara44820803) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/jussaramarquesatriz) | [IMDb](https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3779142)

Jussara Marques de Oliveira is a Brazilian actress, voice actress and dubbing director.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Debby Ryan (Most of the productions)
- Rebeka "Rebe" Parrilla de Bormujo Ávalos (Elite)
- Valkyrie (Marvel Cinematic Universe)
- Jett (Valorant)
- Eloise Bridgerton (Bridgerton)
- Helga Geraldine Pataki (Hey Arnold!)
- Kelsi Willow Nielsen (High School Musical trilogy)
- Mari (Grand Chase and Grand Chase Dimensional Chaser)
- Cobalt-B and Rubilia (Tower of Fantasy)
- Assistant Mayor Dawn Bellwether (Zootopia)
- Danielle Curtin (Prison Break)
- Frankie (The Walking Dead)
- Haley Gwendolyn Dunphy (1st voice - 1st-6th season; Modern Family)
- Emily Elizabeth Howard (1st dub; Clifford the Big Red Dog)
- Jade Chan (1st voice; Jackie Chan Adventures)
- Angel Salvadore (X-Men: First Class)
- Nele Springer (Cyberpunk 2077: Phantom Liberty)
- Brianna G. Buttowski (Kick Buttowski: Suburban Daredevil)
!~

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/palomabsn/)

Paloma Nascimento is a Brazilian translator and businesswoman.
Former Head of the Production Department at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/). Currently Producer at Chocolate Inc.
